text: DNA that's the crinkly colorful strand
forms loops that bring certain genes
around and into contact with the piece
of DNA that regulates them that flips
the switch turning those jeans on here's
how it happens a two-part protein
complex that's the yellow figure eight
forms around the DNA the loops slide in
opposite directions and push out another
loop the new loop expands until each
side hits a stop signal bat-signal acts
as the landing site for a protein called
ctcf those stop signs become the loop
anchors and the anchored loop becomes a
domain inside it the genes and other DNA
have a much higher chance of interacting
than when they were not part of the loop
